<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/29/vaccine-mandates-are-highly-effective-at-getting-hesitant-workers-to-vax-up-early-data-shows?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Workers Choose the Jab Instead of the Exit Door
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/29/vaccine-mandates-are-highly-effective-at-getting-hesitant-workers-to-vax-up-early-data-shows?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="United worker gets vaccinated against Covid-19" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/6740f193f78dfff91db6b512c0299c4344c37119-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Scott Olson/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Several big vaccine mandate deadlines hit this week—so what have we learned? They appear to be effective at driving up vaccination rates.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One of the most high-profile mandates in Corporate America was introduced by United Airlines, the first airline to require its employees to get vaxed. On Tuesday, United said that more than 99% of its ~67,000 US workers have complied with the requirement, and <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/transportation/2021/09/28/united-airlines-vaccine-requirement/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">just 593</a> face termination.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For comparison, Delta Air Lines, which doesn’t have a vaccine mandate but will soon raise health insurance costs for unvaxed employees, says that 82% of its employees are vaccinated.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Another closely watched mandate was implemented by New York’s health system, which <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/28/nyregion/vaccine-health-care-workers-mandate.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">required</a> all workers to have at least one vaccine dose by Monday. That deadline appeared to drive a spike in vaccinations: 92% of the state’s 650,000+ hospital and nursing home workers have received one dose, up from the low-80% range it at just one week ago.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There are notable exceptions in which the vaccine mandate has resulted in staff shortages. Oneida Health in New York lost <a href="https://www.uticaod.com/story/news/2021/09/28/mohawk-valley-hospitals-lose-workers-vaccine-mandate-delays-expected/5905691001/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">about 12%</a> of its workforce this week, per officials.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">All eyes on the NBA</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The conversation around vaccine mandates spilled onto the basketball court this week, when observers pointed out that Brooklyn Nets star Kyrie Irving, who is unvaccinated, would have to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/nba-covid-19-vaccinations-kyrie-irving-andrew-wiggins-11632766044?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sit out</a> all of the team’s home games this upcoming season. The NBA is not mandating vaccinations, but New York City does require it for anyone entering an indoor arena.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Around 90% of NBA players are vaccinated, much higher than the US’ overall vaccination rate, but the league is likely frustrated that one of its most influential stars is, at least for now, bucking the trend.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To increase pressure on unvaccinated players like Irving to get their shots, the NBA said yesterday it would <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/88c78865-57a1-4721-b680-e0fc169f1559?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not pay players</a> who miss games for failing to adhere to local vaccination requirements.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we’re here: </strong>YouTube is <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/09/29/1041493544/youtube-vaccine-misinformation-ban?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">banning</a> all content that spreads vaccine misinformation.<em>—NF</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/29/dollar-tree-says-it-will-add-more-items-that-cost-over-usd1?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Dollar Store Ain’t What It Used to Be
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/29/dollar-tree-says-it-will-add-more-items-that-cost-over-usd1?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Dollar Tree front window with " Everything's $1"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/7d5f423c6fd875e8d389281cee50f38a6e681117-1024x641.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>FREDERIC J. BROWN/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a humbling act of defeat, Dollar Tree <a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-lifestyle-economy-virginia-prices-21e4bcc5434361d23635a290774e4f0b?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> yesterday that it’s adding items that cost $1.25 and even $1.50. The bargain store already offers some higher-priced items in its Dollar Tree Plus section, but yesterday’s announcement is a consequence of supply chain bottlenecks and higher costs.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In July, annual US inflation rates hit their highest point in 30 years.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s a quarter or two extra?</strong> Since it opened in 1986, Dollar Tree hasn’t wavered from its mission to sell cheap meat and off-brand party decor. But recent cost pressures are forcing it to evolve. Most other ultra-discount retailers—Five Below, Dollar General, and even Family Dollar, which Dollar Tree bought in 2015—all regularly price products above the $1 mark.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In 2019, a full-on </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/starboard-walks-away-from-dollar-tree-fight-11554513085?mod=article_inline" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">proxy war</a></span><span> almost broke out because, among other complaints by shareholders, Dollar Tree execs refused to break the buck.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Investors think customers will be able to afford the cost increases. While Dollar Tree shares had fallen 20% this year, they shot up 16% yesterday.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/29/report-reveals-ozy-media-tried-to-trick-goldman-sachs?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Ozy Gets Knocked Off Its Pedestal
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/29/report-reveals-ozy-media-tried-to-trick-goldman-sachs?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Ozy's two cofounders" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/08a69b45607d785cfd874d12b7b21556e5227d7a-1600x900.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Ozy Media</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lies, deceit, impersonations...the story of Ozy Media sounds like it’s straight out of daytime TV. On Sunday, the New York Times <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/26/business/media/ozy-media-goldman-sachs.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released an investigation</a> into Ozy’s sketchy business practices, and the fallout has been postnuclear.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What that report revealed:</strong> On a phone call in February between executives at Ozy and Goldman Sachs—which was at the time considering a $40 million investment into the company—Ozy cofounder and COO Samir Rao impersonated a YouTube exec in order to tout Ozy’s success on the platform.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Ozy’s response:</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> </strong></span><span>Cofounder Carlos Watson confirmed the NYT’s story, adding that Rao was going through a mental health crisis at the time. Even if that’s true, according to Bloomberg's Matt Levine, it would </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2021-09-27/impostors-on-the-due-diligence-call?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not excuse</a></span><span> Ozy from having committed fraud.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This is about more than the phone call. </strong>Ozy had boasted its audience—across its site, newsletters, podcasts, and social media—was in the tens of millions. But media analysts say these numbers are inflated. For example, Ozy has 654,000 Instagram followers but its most recent post got 46 likes. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The latest:</strong> One of Ozy’s earliest investors, SV Angels, <a href="https://www.axios.com/ozy-loses-early-investors-sv-angel-b9ff2700-13f0-4f89-aff9-17205c18d0c6.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surrendered its shares</a> of the company—a super rare slap-in-the-finance that underscores the seriousness of these accusations.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/29/key-performance-indicators?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>The number of eviction filings in major US metropolitan areas has <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/09/28/eviction-cliff-moratorium-rental-assistance/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stayed flat or even dropped</a> in the month after the national eviction moratorium was struck down by the Supreme Court, perplexing experts who predicted a “tidal wave” of evictions after the ruling.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“In tonight’s performance, the role of the duck will be played by a beet, doing things no root vegetable should be asked to do.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The NYT’s food critic Pete Wells <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/28/dining/eleven-madison-park-restaurant-review-plant-based.html?partner=slack&smid=sl-share" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reviewed</a> legendary restaurant Eleven Madison Park’s new all-vegan menu. Seems like he did not enjoy it all that much.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>How a team of musicologists and computer scientists completed Beethoven’s unfinished 10th Symphony using AI. (<a href="https://theconversation.com/how-a-team-of-musicologists-and-computer-scientists-completed-beethovens-unfinished-10th-symphony-168160?utm_source=nextdraft&utm_medium=email" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Conversation</a>)</p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/29/macy-s-sues-over-potential-amazon-billboard?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Macy’s Fights for Prime Real Estate
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/29/macy-s-sues-over-potential-amazon-billboard?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Macy's Billboard on flagship store in Manhattan" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/72d3777a2904f0c5393abdc5108375d974961dd0-2782x1364.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Macy's</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It appears that Amazon is after another piece of Macy’s business: its iconic NYC billboard. And like anyone with property that close to a Shake Shack, the department store chain is holding onto it for dear life, even <a href="https://therealdeal.com/2021/09/29/macys-to-amazon-not-in-my-house/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suing</a> the ad agency that owns the billboard.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> The billboard on the OG Herald Square store has featured the Macy’s logo since the 1960s. But Macy's execs claim that the Kaufman Organization, which owns the billboard, was in talks with a “prominent online retailer” in May that they surmised to be Amazon. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Macy’s said an ad from a company like Amazon would damage the “customer goodwill, image, reputation, and brand,” according to the filing.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Macy’s reminded Kaufman that its original lease stated that other retailers were “indefinitely barred” from advertising on the sign.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Neither Amazon nor Kaufman have responded to the lawsuit or the claims.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Macy’s didn’t need a pep talk to take on the e-commerce king. The chain <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/19/macys-m-q2-2021-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">crushed</a> Q2 earnings and reported that digital customers accounted for 41% of its 5 million new shoppers last quarter.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The last of the ivory-billed woodpeckers: </strong>The US Fish and Wildlife Service proposed removing 23 species from the endangered species list because they went extinct. <a href="https://www.fws.gov/news/ShowNews.cfm?ref=u.s.-fish-and-wildlife-service-proposes-delisting-23-species-from-&_ID=37017" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">See the list here</a>.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Two stranger things: </strong>1) The <a href="https://www.dswai.ie/miniature-walling-festival?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">miniature dry stone walling festival</a> and 2) why are you the way you are, <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zJ69ny57pR0" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">English language</a>?</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Puzzle Section
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>Today's puzzle features a cameo by Amazon's new robot. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/29/brew-mini-robot?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Play it here</a>. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Three Headlines and a Lie</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real and one is faker than whatever an adaptogen is. Can you guess the odd one out?</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Blogger and cookbook author the Pioneer Woman is floating the idea of </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/2xPS9bJpkDXWvgcW4L/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e47tp6v5ymrj8k3b8gkehdyg4n4ez66wle7yc3d9gbi&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">creating</a></span><span> a VC firm.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Errant turtle </span><span><a href="https://mainichi.jp/english/articles/20210925/p2a/00m/0na/007000c?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closes runway</a></span><span>, delays turtle-themed plane at Japan's Narita Airport.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A museum says they gave an artist </span><span><a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/jens-haaning-take-the-money-and-run-blank-canvases/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$84,000 in cash</a></span><span> to use in artwork. He delivered blank canvases and titled them “Take the Money and Run.”</span>

hit this week—so what have we learned? They appear to be effective at driving up vaccination rates.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne of the most high-profile mandates in Corporate America was introduced by United Airlines, the first airline to require its employees to get vaxed. On Tuesday, United said that more than 99% of its ~67,000 US workers have complied with the requirement, and \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/transportation/2021/09/28/united-airlines-vaccine-requirement/?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejust 593\u003c/a\u003e face termination.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFor comparison, Delta Air Lines, which doesn’t have a vaccine mandate but will soon raise health insurance costs for unvaxed employees, says that 82% of its employees are vaccinated.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnother closely watched mandate was implemented by New York’s health system, which \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/28/nyregion/vaccine-health-care-workers-mandate.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erequired\u003c/a\u003e all workers to have at least one vaccine dose by Monday. That deadline appeared to drive a spike in vaccinations: 92% of the state’s 650,000+ hospital and nursing home workers have received one dose, up from the low-80% range it at just one week ago.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere are notable exceptions in which the vaccine mandate has resulted in staff shortages. Oneida Health in New York lost \u003ca href=\"https://www.uticaod.com/story/news/2021/09/28/mohawk-valley-hospitals-lose-workers-vaccine-mandate-delays-expected/5905691001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eabout 12%\u003c/a\u003e of its workforce this week, per officials.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAll eyes on the NBA\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe conversation around vaccine mandates spilled onto the basketball court this week, when observers pointed out that Brooklyn Nets star Kyrie Irving, who is unvaccinated, would have to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/nba-covid-19-vaccinations-kyrie-irving-andrew-wiggins-11632766044?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esit out\u003c/a\u003e all of the team’s home games this upcoming season. The NBA is not mandating vaccinations, but New York City does require it for anyone entering an indoor arena.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAround 90% of NBA players are vaccinated, much higher than the US’ overall vaccination rate, but the league is likely frustrated that one of its most influential stars is, at least for now, bucking the trend.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo increase pressure on unvaccinated players like Irving to get their shots, the NBA said yesterday it would \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/88c78865-57a1-4721-b680-e0fc169f1559?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot pay players\u003c/a\u003e who miss games for failing to adhere to local vaccination requirements.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we’re here: \u003c/strong\u003eYouTube is \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/09/29/1041493544/youtube-vaccine-misinformation-ban?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebanning\u003c/a\u003e all content that spreads vaccine misinformation.\u003cem\u003e—NF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nA Dollar Store Ain’t What It Used to Be\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/7d5f423c6fd875e8d389281cee50f38a6e681117-1024x641.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFREDERIC J. BROWN/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a humbling act of defeat, Dollar Tree \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/business-lifestyle-economy-virginia-prices-21e4bcc5434361d23635a290774e4f0b?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that it’s adding items that cost $1.25 and even $1.50. The bargain store already offers some higher-priced items in its Dollar Tree Plus section, but yesterday’s announcement is a consequence of supply chain bottlenecks and higher costs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn July, annual US inflation rates hit their highest point in 30 years.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s a quarter or two extra?\u003c/strong\u003e Since it opened in 1986, Dollar Tree hasn’t wavered from its mission to sell cheap meat and off-brand party decor. But recent cost pressures are forcing it to evolve. Most other ultra-discount retailers—Five Below, Dollar General, and even Family Dollar, which Dollar Tree bought in 2015—all regularly price products above the $1 mark.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn 2019, a full-on \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/starboard-walks-away-from-dollar-tree-fight-11554513085?mod=article_inline\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eproxy war\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e almost broke out because, among other complaints by shareholders, Dollar Tree execs refused to break the buck.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Investors think customers will be able to afford the cost increases. While Dollar Tree shares had fallen 20% this year, they shot up 16% yesterday.\u003cem\u003e—MM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable Media\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLies, deceit, impersonations...the story of Ozy Media sounds like it’s straight out of daytime TV. On Sunday, the New York Times \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/26/business/media/ozy-media-goldman-sachs.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased an investigation\u003c/a\u003e into Ozy’s sketchy business practices, and the fallout has been postnuclear.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat that report revealed:\u003c/strong\u003e On a phone call in February between executives at Ozy and Goldman Sachs—which was at the time considering a $40 million investment into the company—Ozy cofounder and COO Samir Rao impersonated a YouTube exec in order to tout Ozy’s success on the platform.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOzy’s response:\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCofounder Carlos Watson confirmed the NYT’s story, adding that Rao was going through a mental health crisis at the time. Even if that’s true, according to Bloomberg's Matt Levine, it would \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2021-09-27/impostors-on-the-due-diligence-call?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot excuse\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Ozy from having committed fraud.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThis is about more than the phone call. \u003c/strong\u003eOzy had boasted its audience—across its site, newsletters, podcasts, and social media—was in the tens of millions. But media analysts say these numbers are inflated. For example, Ozy has 654,000 Instagram followers but its most recent post got 46 likes. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe latest:\u003c/strong\u003e One of Ozy’s earliest investors, SV Angels, \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/ozy-loses-early-investors-sv-angel-b9ff2700-13f0-4f89-aff9-17205c18d0c6.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurrendered its shares\u003c/a\u003e of the company—a super rare slap-in-the-finance that underscores the seriousness of these accusations.\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt appears that Amazon is after another piece of Macy’s business: its iconic NYC billboard. And like anyone with property that close to a Shake Shack, the department store chain is holding onto it for dear life, even \u003ca href=\"https://therealdeal.com/2021/09/29/macys-to-amazon-not-in-my-house/?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuing\u003c/a\u003e the ad agency that owns the billboard.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e The billboard on the OG Herald Square store has featured the Macy’s logo since the 1960s. But Macy's execs claim that the Kaufman Organization, which owns the billboard, was in talks with a “prominent online retailer” in May that they surmised to be Amazon. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMacy’s said an ad from a company like Amazon would damage the “customer goodwill, image, reputation, and brand,” according to the filing.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMacy’s reminded Kaufman that its original lease stated that other retailers were “indefinitely barred” from advertising on the sign.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNeither Amazon nor Kaufman have responded to the lawsuit or the claims.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Macy’s didn’t need a pep talk to take on the e-commerce king. The chain \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/19/macys-m-q2-2021-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecrushed\u003c/a\u003e Q2 earnings and reported that digital customers accounted for 41% of its 5 million new shoppers last
